page.title: 05INTERVIEW: FORMER TEACHER
page.content: {MISS. D. KERR}taught in{Stoer School from 1961 until 1978. She had attended the school herself and remembers when there were around twenty pupils in the one classroom and four teachers including the headmaster.She went on to{Glasgow University}and completed her training in{Jordanhill College. In her first teaching post in Glasgow she has 46 pupils to cope with.When she returned to teach in Stoer there were only 12 pupils from Primary 1-7. Even with so few pupils she still felt she was fairly strict, only using the belt as punishment when it was necessary to make an example. She also remembers when there was only a stove to heat the classroom. After one particularly stormy day in 1965 when the classroom window blew in she convinced the Local Councillor that some improvements were essential.
